subproject.description: In March 2009, Sierra Leone was hit by the biggest eruption of violence since the end of the conflict in 2002.Violent clashes involving the supporters of the two main parties resulted in multiple injuries and destruction. On April 2, the two parties publicly pledges to work together to prevent further political violence in the country. In a joint communiqué signed in front of President and witnessed by the ERSG, the All Peoples Congress (APC) and the Sierra Leone People’s Party (SLPP) vowed to “work jointly in preventing all forms of political incitement, provocation and intimidation”. By the same taken, this support helps give the SLPP leadership the right disposition to participate in the implementation of the joint Communiqué.
subproject.gender code: No noticeable contribution to gender equality
subproject.title: PBF-REFURBISHMENT OF SLPP OFFI

title: Refurbishment of SLPP Paty Head Office
